snippet: A May 19 column about telemarketing calls and robocalls elicited responses from several frustrated readers, who say unwanted calls seem to be increasing.
abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column expands on the frustrations of receiving unwanted telemarketing calls; notes that many individuals feel the Do Not Call Registry is less effective than it was when it was created in 2003, and that reporting calls to the Federal Trade Commission is futile.
lead_paragraph: A May 19 column about telemarketing calls and robocalls elicited responses from several frustrated readers, who say unwanted calls seem to be increasing.

headline.seo: Readers Say Unwanted Robocalls Are Growing Problem
headline.main: Resilience of Robocalls Leaves a Lot of Ears Ringing
headline.print_headline: Resilience of Robocalls Leaves a Lot of Ears Ringing
